headline.main: DR. ANNA H. SHAW, SUFFRAGIST, DIES; Seized with Recurrence of Pneumonia Attack of Month AgoWhile on Tour with Taft.END IN MOYLAN, PA., HOMELeader Fought Poverty in Her Youth, Taught School at 15, andBecame Pioneer Woman Minister. Dr. Shaw's Long Life of Service. Pioneer Among Women in the Ministry. Earned Service Cross in the War.

abstract: Reception in his honor at Paris City Hall
snippet: PHILADELPHIA, July 2.--Dr. Anna Howard Shaw, honorary President of the National American Woman's Suffrage Association, died at her home in Moylan, Penn., near here, at 7 o'clock this evening. She was 72 years old.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: NATIONAL ASSOC OPPOSED TO WOMAN SUFFRAGE
